segments.text: Where do you think we should go on holiday this summer ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We , I ’ d like to go to Australia . I know it ’ s far to go , but I think it would be something different and special .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ d really like to go to the Caribbean . We can relax on the beached and enjoy the sunshine .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: There are beaches in Australia too , but I would prefer a more active holiday this year . We could visit Ayers rock and the great barrier reef . It would be so exciting .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: But would it be relaxing ? By summer . I ’ ll be quite tired from doing so much work . The last thing I need is to use more energy racing around Australia . I ’ d need another holiday to recover from the holiday !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , come on ! A tour of Australia would be relaxing because you ’ d be doing something different and not working .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you think so ? I ’ m not so sure . Anyway , tell me your plans for an Australian holiday . How long do you think we should spend there ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think we should go for two weeks . We could spend a week in the bush and a week at the great barrier reef-including a few day on the beach for tired office workers !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That doesn ’ t sound too bad . I ’ d certainly like to go diving . That ’ s one reason I wanted to go to the Caribbean .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We could hire a car and travel around the interior of Australia for several days . If we hire a car , we can go where we like .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: We ’ d have to plan our drive before we leave . Let ’ s get a good guidebook from the bookstore when we go shopping in town tomorrow .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It looks like I might have convinced you to go to Australia !
segments.speaker: S2
